channel.title: Further Data Maps
channel.description:
I went back & played Half-life's demo Half-Life: Uplink not too long ago & as the demo ends the screen fades to black & the words "further data needed" pop up on the screen. Well, I just remembered that valve actually made a free promotional CD called [url='https://www.halflifeuplink.com/furtherdata/']Further Data[/url] that contains 5 deathmatch maps not included in the retail version of Half-Life:
* doublecross * rustmill * team9 * thehill * xen_dm
I'm just curious to see the opinions of the maps by those who hadn't played them before & who'd be interested in seeing these maps be remade for Black Mesa.

item.title: Further Data Maps
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
dky.tehkingd.u:

Seeing as BMDM development isn’t being focused on for the time being, I’d think you still have some time to suggest these as viable maps.

That’s what I had intended. It was moved here from The Cafeteria.

Read full topic

item.title: Further Data Maps
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Most players probably don’t know it exists, sadly. A few of the maps are already in the Steam HL, but I had no idea there was a xen deathmatch map. That sounds cool- it would probably be the only map where low gravity would be the map default.

Read full topic

item.title: Further Data Maps
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
I always though it was strange that HLDM didn’t have a single official Xen map, then when I found out it did I saw these maps weren’t listed on the BMDM Map category of the wiki. Sadly it seems we’re the only ones who want to see xen_dm in Black Mesa.

A shame that this thread got moved to the Half-Life subforum, when I meant for it to go in the Suggestion Box.

Read full topic

item.title: Further Data Maps
item.dc:creator: deadlife101
item.description:
I want to see xen_dm in Black Mesa. I love those Further data maps.

Read full topic

item.title: Further Data Maps
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
ManlyStump:

Oh ok, in that case who cares

Normally I’d be one to agree with you. I’m not a big fan of multiplayer in general, but I figured since this is content released by valve for Half-Life 1, I thought there might be people interested in seeing some of it remade in Black Mesa: Deathmatch.

I also thought that some people here might get to play these maps for their first time & be able to give their opinions of the maps without being completely clouded by nostalgia goggles.

Read full topic
